Description: Pair of two curtains. Undyed linen ground with tapestry-weave decoration in coloured wool. Band containing a green vine-stem on red ground across the top. Below erots holding garlands. Pair of Nike figures holding a greek cross with an inscription.
Curator's comments: Published: Ein Gott 2015, no. 114, p. 108. Cf. MMA 12.182.45 (https://www.metmuseum.org/art/collection/search/446223?&searchField=All&sortBy=Relevance&deptids=20%7c14&ft=egypt+textile+bird&offset=40&rpp=20&pos=60)
Bibliographic references: Buckton 1994 / Byzantium: Treasures of Byzantine art and culture from British collections (no.112, p.102-103) (by Hero Granger-Taylor)
Fluck et al. 2015 / Egypt: Faith after the Pharaohs (p.106)
Exhibition history: 2015-2016, Oct 29-Feb 7, London, BM, G35, Egypt: Faith after the Pharaohs 2023-2024 13 Nov-3 Mar, New York, Metropolitan Museum, Africa and Byzantium
Acquisition name: Purchased through: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
